prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top and a Flat Bottom Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles should all be set to 0.0, and the translation vector should be [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will ensure the coordinate system is aligned with the default position and orientation. Sketching the Top Face Next, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Create the following loops and curves in sequence: 1. Create an arc (arc\\_1) with a start point at [0.0, 0.15], a mid point at [0.0439, 0.0439], and an end point at [0.15, 0.0]. 2. Create a line (line\\_1) with a start point at [0.15, 0.0] and an end point at [0.375, 0.0]. 3. Create an arc (arc\\_2) with a start point at [0.375, 0.0], a mid point at [0.4185, 0.068], and an end point at [0.4985, 0.0572]. 4. Create a line (line\\_2) with a start point at [0.4985, 0.0572] and an end point at [0.6, 0.0]. 5. Create a line (line\\_3) with a start point at [0.6, 0.0] and an end point at [0.75, 0.225]. 6. Create an arc (arc\\_3) with a start point at [0.75, 0.225], a mid point at [0.675, 0.3], and an end point at [0.75, 0.375]. 7. Create a line (line\\_4) with a start point at [0.75, 0.375] and an end point at [0.75, 0.6]. 8. Create an arc (arc\\_4) with a start point at [0.75, 0.6], a mid point at [0.7061, 0.7061], and an end point at [0.6, 0.75]. 9. Create a line (line\\_5) with a start point at [0.6, 0.75] and an end point at [0.0, 0.75]. 10. Create a line (line\\_6) with a start point at [0.0, 0.75] and an end point at [0.0, 0.525]. 11. Create an arc (arc\\_5) with a start point at [0.0, 0.525], a mid point at [0.075, 0.45], and an end point at [0.0, 0.375]. 12. Create a line (line\\_7) with a start point at [0.0, 0.375] and an end point at [0.0, 0.15]. Extruding the Sketch Now that the sketch is complete, extrude it as follows: - Set the `extrude_depth_towards_normal` value to 0.15. - Keep the `extrude_depth_opposite_normal` value at 0.0. - Set the `sketch_scale` value to 0.75 to scale the sketch before extruding. - The extrusion operation should create a new solid body. The resulting part should have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.15 The part is now complete, consisting of a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges are rounded, and the sides are straight. The object has a hole in the center of the top face. Continue with constructing subsequent parts as per the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>

Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.4608]. This creates the second side of the rectangle. 3. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.4608] to point [0.375, 0.75]. This creates the third side of the rectangle. 4. Draw a line from point [0.375, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.75]. This creates the fourth side of the rectangle. 5. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.0]. This closes the rectangle. **Step 4: Form the loops and faces** 1. Create a loop with the five lines. This forms the first face of the prism. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to 3D** 1. Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units along the positive Z direction. 2. Scale the sketch by 0.75. **Additional information** - The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. - The length of the part is 0.75 units. - The width of the part is 0.75 units. - The height of the part is 0.75 units.</description>
